decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells, card manipulation, and removal spells. The key cards in this deck are Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top, which work together to counter spells of various mana costs. This deck aims to control the game tempo, build card advantage, and eventually win through powerful finishers like Entreat the Angels and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Overall, this deck thrives on maintaining control of the game and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the powerful combo of Show and Tell, along with either Omniscience or Sneak Attack, to cheat out massive threats like Griselbrand or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield. The deck aims to disrupt opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also having access to tutoring effects like Cunning Wish. The deck is designed to generate a high amount of mana through lands like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb, as well as fast mana sources like Lotus Petal.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to establish early game control through cards like Counterbalance, Sensei's Divining Top, and Force of Will, while keeping the opponent's threats at bay with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and tempo with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, and achieve a late-game advantage with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Finally, the inclusion of Snapcaster Mage and Monastery Mentor provides additional value and threats to close out the game.

The central idea of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Wasteland. The deck focuses on maintaining tempo and controlling the board with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, backed up by countermagic such as Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also utilizes card selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as card advantage engines like Gitaxian Probe and Deathrite Shaman to maintain consistency and pressure.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with powerful counterspells and removal spells while using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Monastery Mentor to generate card advantage and create threats. The deck aims to manipulate the top of its library with cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance to consistently have answers to opponents' threats. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to outlast opponents and establish board control to secure victory in the late game.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using efficient and versatile creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Young Pyromancer. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and countermagic like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to maintain control of the board while dealing damage with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck, while also utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board using efficient removal and countermagic while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Vendilion Clique to quickly close out the game. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to different scenarios and opponent strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Food Chain combo to generate infinite mana and then cast creatures such as Misthollow Griffin and Tidespout Tyrant for free to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and removal to control the game while setting up the combo. It also includes a small toolbox of creatures such as Baleful Strix and Gurmag Angler to provide additional utility and threats. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's three-color requirements and maximize consistency in finding the necessary lands.

This deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Stormchaser Mage, while utilizing efficient spells like Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Price of Progress to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes cantrips like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Gitaxian Probe to ensure consistent card draw and manipulation, along with countermagic in the form of Daze and Force of Will to protect its game plan. With a mana base of fetchlands and dual lands, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game swiftly.

This deck aims to quickly assemble and protect its combo pieces to deal lethal poison damage in a single turn. By utilizing fast mana acceleration and efficient infect creatures, the deck can overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to fully develop their board. The inclusion of disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze allows the deck to protect its combo while disrupting opposing strategies. With the right sequencing and play skill, this deck can surprise opponents with its explosive potential and close out games in a swift and decisive fashion.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Crop Rotation and Expedition Map to find the necessary pieces. Thespian's Stage can copy Dark Depths to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in just one turn, putting immense pressure on the opponent. Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Duress help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Brainstorm provides card selection. With a mix of disruption and speed, this deck aims to win the game with the powerful Dark Depths combo.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to slow down opponents' strategies. With the ability to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponents' plans, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The key strategy is to establish an early board presence and maintain control of the game through efficient mana usage and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll, Stinkweed Imp, and Putrid Imp using card draw spells like Careful Study and Faithless Looting. Once the graveyard is loaded, the deck can utilize cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win. The deck focuses on graveyard recursion and explosive combos to quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on quickly casting multiple spells in a single turn to generate a large storm count, which allows for powerful plays like casting Tendrils of Agony to drain the opponent's life total. The deck utilizes cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly, as well as cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to help dig for combo pieces, while also running cards like Infernal Tutor and Dark Petition to tutor for key cards.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, card advantage, and board wipes. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top, the deck aims to control the opponent's spells and maintain card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. With a suite of powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, the deck can answer threats efficiently. Additionally, the deck can win through incremental advantage with Entreat the Angels or closing out the game with a resolved Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the top of the opponent's library, while also having access to powerful win conditions like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. The deck aims to out-value the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and generating card advantage, ultimately leading to a secure victory.
